p: Additionally, the maximal non-lethal concentration (MNLC) – denoting the maximum concentration used which does not result in a statistically higher mortality rate of zebrafish embryos/larvae than in the control group during the experiment – for each examined trifluoromethylated fused triazinone ( I– VIII) and pemetrexed was established ( Table 1). It was proven that the molecules IV, II, I, V and VI (with the MNLC from 20 to 8.3 mg L −1) are less toxic than pemetrexed (with the MNLC = 4.2 mg L −1), while the toxicity of compounds III and VII (with the MNLC = 6.7 and 5 mg L −1, respectively) is close to that of this anticancer drug. Among all the compounds tested, only VIII (with MNLC = 3.3 mg L −1) was found to be slightly more toxic than pemetrexed.
